ctreq.title: CTREQ - Quebec Educational Platform
ctreq.description: Complete redesign and merger of two WordPress sites (CTREQ + RIRE) into a headless Next.js 13 platform. Structured migration of +10 content types, triple cache architecture (~50ms), advanced SEO and skills transfer plan for client team.
ctreq.longDescription: Large-scale institutional project for the Quebec Center for Educational Success Transfer: complete merger of two historic WordPress platforms (CTREQ + RIRE) into a unified modern system. Structured migration of +10 custom content types with complete architecture reconstruction (CPT + ACF + taxonomies), data schema harmonization and cross-validation of relationships. Headless Next.js 13 App Router architecture with exceptional performance (<100ms) thanks to a sophisticated triple cache strategy (memory + ISR + SWR). Direct collaboration with CTREQ management over 6 months in complete autonomy, including business needs analysis, request prioritization, continuous deliverable validation with Caroline B. and Pape-Moussa D. Production of official transfer plan with complete technical documentation, WordPress editor training and maintenance procedures. Next.js standalone deployment on cPanel with Passenger configuration, log monitoring and automated Lighthouse CI tests.
features: Complete merger of two historic WordPress sites (CTREQ + RIRE) into unified system
Structured migration of +10 content types: CPT, taxonomies and ACF fields recovery from old plugin
Clean WordPress architecture reconstruction with ACF schema harmonization
Controlled Export/Import via WP All Export/Import with cross-validation of data and relationships
Complete 301 redirect plan between both ecosystems to preserve SEO
Headless CMS architecture with Next.js 13 App Router and React Server Components
Unified aggregation of 3 WordPress sources (RIRE, Thematic Files, Resources) via WPGraphQL
Sophisticated triple cache system: memory (~50ms) + Next.js ISR + Stale-While-Revalidate
WordPress webhook for automatic real-time cache invalidation
Advanced SEO: JSON-LD Structured Data (Organization, WebSite, WebPage), dynamic XML sitemaps
Quebec-targeted geolocation (fr-CA) with enriched metadata and canonical URLs
WCAG AA accessible interface with 30+ Radix UI components (Accordion, Dialog, Select, etc.)
shadcn/ui design system with custom Tailwind theme and CSS variables (dark mode ready)
Advanced multi-criteria filters: educational themes, resource types, school levels
Robust forms with React Hook Form + Zod validation
Strict Content Security Policy and reinforced security headers (HSTS, X-Frame-Options)
Complete GDPR management: cookie consent, privacy policy
Google Analytics 4 with custom event tracking
Next.js standalone deployment on cPanel: Node.js 18 + Passenger + optimized .htaccess
Automated deployment scripts with static files support /_next/
Monitoring & structured logs: Next.js/Express server logs, cPanel production debugging
Automated Lighthouse CI tests and webhook logging for integrity
Official Transfer Plan production: complete Next.js/WPGraphQL technical documentation
WordPress editor training with content addition procedures and architecture guide
Dynamic breadcrumbs, scroll progress indicator and elegant loading states
challenges: Merger of two WordPress platforms with different histories and inconsistency detection
Massive migration: +10 content types, data standardization, complex relationships
Complete WordPress architecture reconstruction (CPT + ACF + taxonomies) without data loss
Cross-validation of exports/imports: media files, dynamic taxonomies, relational fields
Complete 301 redirect plan to preserve SEO of both sites
Unification of 3 heterogeneous WordPress sources via unified GraphQL API model
Intelligent multi-layer cache architecture with SWR strategy for zero downtime
Selective cache invalidation via webhooks without impacting global performance
Multi-environment SEO with automatic staging/production detection (X-Robots-Tag)
Extreme performance: First Contentful Paint < 1s, Time to Interactive < 2s, CLS < 0.1
TypeScript strict mode on 100% of codebase with automatic GraphQL type generation
GraphQL complexity management: N+1 problem resolution, overfetching via fragments and caching
cPanel deployment with constraints: Node.js standalone, absolute paths, Apache rewrite
Production debugging: Node.js, rewrite rules, _next/ assets management
Client collaboration: regular exchanges with management, business needs analysis, prioritization
Complete autonomy over 6 months: design, development, migration, DevOps, documentation
Technical documentation production for skills transfer to CTREQ team
